resources.string: Welcome to Saturn Papers, your new favorite wallpapers app.
Every day you will see a new and cool astronomic photo as your new wallpaper. \n You can turn off this feature in the app settings.
Did you fall in love with a photo? you can download it with a click.
The Astronomic Picture Of the Day
Colorful Airglow Bands Surround Milky Way

Why would the sky glow like a giant repeating rainbow? Airglow. Now air glows all of the time, but it is usually hard to see. A disturbance however — like an approaching storm — may cause noticeable rippling in the Earth\'s atmosphere. These gravity waves are oscillations in air analogous to those created when a rock is thrown in calm water. Red airglow likely originates from OH molecules about 87-kilometers high, excited by ultraviolet light from the Sun, while orange and green airglow is likely caused by sodium and oxygen atoms slightly higher up. While driving near Keluke Lake in Qinghai Provence in China a few years ago, the photographer originally noticed
